title: (x) "Thank you for your generosity" straight-sided slab serif - Done {Dennis}
content:
Sorry . . . it helps to make sure the attachment is there. Any assistance on this font’s name would be wonderful.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [thank you.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010113226/http:/typophile.com/files/thank%20you_0.jpg) | 25.03 KB |

 [‹ (x) Darkroom Architecture store logo - Helvetica {Jacopo}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010113226/http:/typophile.com/node/20849 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Jaarda Design logo - Horatio, DIN 1451 Engschrift {Mark S, Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010113226/http:/typophile.com/node/20781 "Go to next forum topic")
author: CarolynACP

comments.content:
OK... kind of reminds me of 1) a Ray Larabie face or 2) a PsyOps face.

Two avenues to pursue...I’ll give them a shot.

—Michael.

———————————————————————————  
// love what you do or do something else. //  
Michael Ebert — graphic designer, jazz saxophonist, horror movie devotee  
 [http://homepage.mac.com/mwebert](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010113226/http:/homepage.mac.com/mwebert "http://homepage.mac.com/mwebert")  
 [mwebert@mac.com](mailto:mwebert@mac.com)  
———————

Nope, I think it’s [_Covington_](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010113226/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/lab/a_d.htm) by the Apostrophic Lab.

—Michael.

———————————————————————————  
// love what you do or do something else. //  
Michael Ebert — graphic designer, jazz saxophonist, horror movie devotee  
 [http://homepage.mac.com/mwebert](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010113226/http:/homepage.mac.com/mwebert "http://homepage.mac.com/mwebert")  
 [mwebert@mac.com](mailto:mwebert@mac.com)  
———————
Done by Derek Vogelpohl of Shyfonts fame.

Michael, ’Covington’ is extremely close, but there seem to be some differences in details of letters. However, I couldn’t find ’Done’ anywhere. Dennis, can you give me an idea where to find it?

- Mike Yanega
Thanks VERY much. I don’t think I would have found this one. You’ve solved a big mystery for me.

_I couldn’t find ‘Done’ anywhere_

I meant made by Derek. I think it is the bold version which is #3 in the pack.

I was recently asking about him, and a friend told me he is pursuing a career in a completely different field.

Duh! Sorry for being so dense. I only looked at one of the weights — I must have picked the wrong one. I should have realized what you meant, and seen that the ’similarities’ were too close. It is indeed #3 that was the Bold weight, and I looked at one of the condensed weights instead.

Carolyn, I’m glad you got your answer.

- Mike Yanega
In all fairness, Michael made the ID. I just jumped on the bandwagon because Derek has been on my mind.

Note to Yves: ’Covington’ was the right answer. And it was _’done’_ (designed) by Derek Vogelpohl. That was my mistake in reading Dennis’s comment.

- Mike Yanega
